result.execSummary:
The defendant KEVIN A FUNCK was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: - Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan.
- Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan.
- Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. KEVIN A FUNCK

records.addlTxt:
10:23 AM Defendant KEVIN A FUNCK in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant would like to proceed without an attorney. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to counsel. Defendant waives right to counsel. Court accepts waiver. ADA recites offer - amend count to a misdemeanor possession of THC with fine and costs and DNA sample. Def will accept offer and plead NO CONTEST.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty to amended possession of THC. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Sentencing statement by ADA. Sentencing statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-$200 fine plus costs. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Court adjourned at 10:29 AM.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Second appearance on May 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant came to the office after court with his bond form, and said he realized that he is scheduled to be traveling out of state on the date of his next hearing, and would be back the following week. Hearing date was not in the computer yet, but bond showed that the next hearing would be May 3, 2022. Minutes showed time limits were waived. Defendant did not have an attorney but stated he will be contacting the PD's office. Court date rescheduled to May 10, 2022. Defendant was given the notice of hearing in person.

9:45 AM Defendant KEVIN A FUNCK in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  ADA makes offer - fine and costs plus and DNA in exchange for plea. Def would like a lawyer. Court schedules Status of Counsel for May 3, 2022 at 10:00 am. ADA makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. 

Court adjourned at 9:48 AM.
